page.title: 12OLD TOWN, EASTBOURNE
page.content: EASTBOURNE GETS ITS NAME FROM THE SAXON WORD BOURNE WHICH MEANS STREAM.EAST WAS ADDED IN THE 14TH CENTURY.THE CENTRE OF THE TOWN WAS NEAR THE PARISH CHURCH OF ST. MARY'S, AT MOTCOMBE PARK WHERE THE STREAM RISES.FOR MANY YEARS EASTBOURNE WAS NOT A VERY IMPORTANT PLACE AND IT WAS NOT UNTIL SEA BATHING BECAME POPULAR AND THE RAILWAY ARRIVED IN THE 19TH CENTURY DID THE TOWN BEGIN TO EXPAND. THE STREETS IN OLD TOWN ARE LAID OUT IN A REGULR BLOCK PATTERN. THE HOUSES ARE SOLID VICTORIAN STYLES BUT NOT AS GRAND AS THOSE BUILT ELSEWHERE IN THE TOWN.THE HOSPITAL USED TO BE A WORKHOUSE AND BEFORE THEN A CAVALRY BARRACKS.NOW IT IS USED AS A CONVELASCENT HOSPITAL BUT MANY OLD FOLK ARE AFRAID OF IT BECAUSE OF THE LINKS WITH THE POOR LAW.
